intro: Erigeron peregrinus subsp. callianthemus, commonly known as the Sierra dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes. It produces small, yellowish to white flowers that bloom in the spring and early summer. The leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its drought-tolerant nature.
